string.Text: Closed captions. Press the spacebar to toggle captions on and off.
Skip navigation. Press enter to return to the slide.

links.slidetitle: Instructions:  Select the best answer for each question.
links.displaytext: Instructions:  Select the best answer for each question.

links.slidetitle: 1. In most financial institutions the credit analysis report is an extensive written dissertation usually comprising between 25-30 pages of all issues associated to the borrower.
links.displaytext: 1. In most financial institutions the credit analysis report is an extensive written dissertation usually comprising between 25-30 pages of all issues associated to the borrower.

links.slidetitle: 2. In writing a credit analysis narrative the analyst must concentrate on providing conclusions, support them with cause and effect relationships, and present only the  most critical issues about the borrower.
links.displaytext: 2. In writing a credit analysis narrative the analyst must concentrate on providing conclusions, support them with cause and effect relationships, and present only the  most critical issues about the borrower.

links.slidetitle: 3. The first section of the credit analysis narrative also includes  information on the financial performance of the borrower.
links.displaytext: 3. The first section of the credit analysis narrative also includes  information on the financial performance of the borrower.

links.slidetitle: 4. The credit analysis narrative supports the conclusion in the loan decision with an analysis of borrower’s competitors and a company’s position in the industry.
links.displaytext: 4. The credit analysis narrative supports the conclusion in the loan decision with an analysis of borrower’s competitors and a company’s position in the industry.

links.slidetitle: 5. The Business Analysis summary includes the discussion of critical issues of the company’s operations including management, industry, competitors, revenue recognition, financial statements and detailed of risks associated with the company’s products.
links.displaytext: 5. The Business Analysis summary includes the discussion of critical issues of the company’s operations including management, industry, competitors, revenue recognition, financial statements and detailed of risks associated with the company’s products.
